pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.5: 60. The training rule on hiding robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.2: On one occasion when the monks from the group of seventeen had not put away their requisites,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.3: the monks from the group of six hid their bowls and robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.4: The monks from the group of seventeen said to them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.6: The monks from the group of six laughed, but the monks from the group of seventeen cried.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.9: “Because the monks from the group of six have hidden our bowls and robes.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.11: “How can the monks from the group of six hide the bowls and robes of other monks?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.15: “… Foolish men, how can you hide the bowls and robes of other monks?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.17: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.18.1: ‘If a monk hides a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.8: There are two kinds of bowls: iron bowls and ceramic bowls.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.10: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.12: one with a border is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.16: there are two kinds of belts: those made from strips of cloth and those made from pigs’ intestines.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.18: if he hides it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.20: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.21: If he only asks once, then even if the other hides a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.22: Even if just for a laugh:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.1: If the other monk is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.2: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.3: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.4: If he hides another requisite, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.5: If he hides the bowl or robe or other requisite of someone who is not fully ordained, or he has it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.8: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.2: if he is not aiming to have fun;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.3: if he puts away what has been improperly put away;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.4: if he puts something away with the thought, “After giving a teaching, I’ll give it back;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.7: The tenth rule, the training rule on hiding robes, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.8: The sixth sub-chapter on drinking alcohol is finished.
